title: PERFORMER
description:
Play Festival
New York City, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Anna-Grace Cummings
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION
Seeking actors for New York City Theater Festival!

A psychological journey into the subconscious of 8th grader, JACOB, and his outlandish epiphany.

CHARACTERS:


JACOB: 13 (almost 14), JV quarterback and assistant coach, HAA’s Most Christlike




PEYTON: 13, wide receiver, a bit cynical, a bit logical. His brother is in a gang.


MASON: 13, linebacker, wildly optimistic. He loves just being there.

As JV assistant coach, quarterback, president of robotics club, alter boy (every Sunday), general member of drama club (for the art credit), and all around Good Samaritan, it was no surprise that Jacob was chosen for this year‘s graduation pageant. Every year students hear the same watered down speech from every previous “Most Christlike;” but Jacob knew he’d be different. Jacob believes he was chosen as Jesus' reincarnate. This is a mighty position to fill, and it’ll take some convincing. Mainly from his fellow JV teammates as speakers in the ceremony, Mason and childhood best friend Peyton. They only have 25 minutes before the ceremony, and it is up to Jacob to teach his friends, and soon to be followers, his divine intervention, no matter what it takes.

Audition Requirements:
-Seeking college age performers
-Submit a 1-2 minute comedic monolouge
-Due by March 1st
-Callbacks will be the following weekend
-Rehearsals during April-May
-Tech: May 17th-24th

IMPORTANT: There is an opening dance number, but we are not seeking trained dancers!!!


Showcase your inner middle school angst;)
DURATION

Apr 11, 2026 - May 24, 2026
HOW TO APPLY
APPLY ONLINE

title: TECHNICAL THEATER PRODUCTION SUPERVISOR
description:
Success Academy Charter Schools
New York, NY
US
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Thanks for your interest in Success Academy! Running a large, fast-growing, and high-performing network of public charter schools takes a village - families, children, teachers, staff and faculty, advocates, and supporters alike. We are growing fast in New York and expanding to Florida, and we would love to welcome you to our community! We work tirelessly every day to ensure children have access to a fun, rigorous, whole-child education regardless of zip code or economic status. When you join SA, you play a part in giving every student who walks through our doors a fair shot at reaching his or her potential.

The Bronx K-12 Technical Theatre Supervisor is a school-based role that additionally oversees and provides supplemental guidance for all K-12 Bronx Campus technical theatre objectives related to the auditorium. This role reports to Success Academy’s Theater Program Manager. This role will be salary-based and required to attend rehearsals that take place after school-based hours and occasionally other duties during the day affiliated with the assembly/maintenance of productions. This role is managed by the Theatre Program Manager.

Roles and Responsibilities

We are seeking a results-driven Technical Theatre Supervisor to serve as the resident technical expert and facility manager for our Bronx K-12 campus. This is not just a "behind-the-scenes" role; it is a leadership position that ensures our scholars perform in professional-grade environments. You will be responsible for the end-to-end technical execution of theatrical productions, high-stakes keynote events, and daily school-wide assemblies.

1. Technical Design & Production Execution
Lighting Design: Conceptualize, hang, circuit, and program lighting plots for all campus productions. Must be proficient in the ETC (Electronic Theatre Controls) ecosystem, including EOS-family consoles.
Sound Engineering: Manage live sound reinforcement and playback. This includes mic’ing performers, mixing live musical theatre/performances on Yamaha digital consoles, and maintaining signal chain integrity.
Multimedia & Projection: Oversee the integration of digital media, projection mapping, and QLab (or similar) workflows for performances and presentations.
Rigging & Safety: Maintain and operate theatrical rigging systems, ensuring all overhead equipment is secured and meets industry safety standards.
2. Asset Management & Operations
Preventative Maintenance: Establish a rigorous schedule for diagnosing, repairing, and maintaining all AV and stage equipment (lighting fixtures, wireless mics, cables, and scenic tools).
Inventory Control: Maintain a meticulously organized digital inventory of all technical assets. Oversee the procurement of expendables (gels, tape, batteries) and advise on long-term capital equipment upgrades.
Space Stewardship: Act as the "warden" of the auditorium; ensure the space is strike-ready after events and that all school-wide staff follow proper safety and equipment protocols.
3. Leadership & Collaboration
Cross-Functional Partnership: Collaborate with the School Operations Team to schedule space usage and ensure the technical needs of non-theatre events (Keynote speakers, graduations) are met.
Educational Support: Provide supplemental guidance and "on-the-job" training to theater teachers or scholars interested in the technical arts.
Rehearsal & Event Supervision: Manage the technical requirements of after-school rehearsals and performances, ensuring a professional atmosphere for scholars and staff.
Candidate Requirements
Technical Expertise
Professional Pedigree: Significant professional credit in technical theatre or a degree from a rigorous technical theatre program.
Console Mastery: Proven experience programming on ETC lighting boards and mixing on Yamaha digital sound boards is required.
Versatility: Ability to pivot from the "fine-tuning" of a lighting cue to the manual labor of assembly and maintenance.
Mindset & Leadership
The ETHOS Standard: You embody Excellence, Teamwork, Humor, Ownership, and Scholar-first decision-making.
High Agency: You don’t wait for things to break; you anticipate needs and "own" the results of the space.
Communication: You have the confidence to lead a room and the presence to represent the Arts program to school leadership.
Physical & Logistical Requirements
Valid Driver’s License: Required for potential travel between sites or picking up supplies.
Physicality: Ability to lift up to 40 lbs, climb ladders, and work in elevated spaces (grids/catwalks).
Flexibility: Availability for evening and occasional weekend hours to support the production calendar.

Exact compensation may vary based on skills and experience.

Compensation Range

$75,000 - $75,000 USD

Success Academy Charter Schools is an equal opportunity employer and actively encourages applications from people of all backgrounds. Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Success Academy offers a full benefits program and opportunities for professional growth.

Privacy Policy:

By providing your phone number, you consent to receive text message updates from Success Academy regarding your application. Reply STOP to unsubscribe. View our Privacy Policy.

Current Success Academies Employees:

Please apply through the Internal Job Board via Greenhouse.

You will be asked to log in through your Okta Profile.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We actively seek applications from people of all backgrounds to strengthen our community and the perspectives needed to flourish in a multicultural world. Success Academy offers a full benefits program and opportunities for professional growth.

Success Academy Charter Schools does not offer employment-based immigration sponsorship.

SALARY

$75,000.00 – $75,000.00 per year

title: LOOKING FOR ACTORS FOR STAGED READING OF NEW PLAY MADAMADAM
description:
Montalo Arts Center
Saratoga, CA
US

CONTACT NAME

Leif Larson
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Looking for six actors to perform in a staged reading of a new play, MADAMADAM. Must be local to the area and able to come to Saratoga for rehearsals and performance.

Where: Montalvo Arts Center

Saratoga, CA 95070



When: Tuesday, April 28 - Evening, time tbd

Availability for a 1 or 2 Zoom rehearsals in March, as well as 3 or 4 in-person rehearsals in Saratoga prior to performance.

Small stipend provided.

About the project:

MADAMADAM is a full length play that explores what happens when a queer man returns to his deadhome - the one he no longer identifies or chooses as his own— in search of a reckoning.

After years of going “no contact” with his mother, Garrett decides to pay her a surprise visit on Thanksgiving Day. Armed with a new radical understanding of himself and his family, his visit disrupts the holiday and sets in motion of a chain of events that will have shocking and unexpected consequences.

ROLES:

GARRETT
40s- 50’s, he/him, white

Gay with an agenda

ANSEL (Garrett's husband)

30-40’s, he/him, any race

Witty, jaded

MARY-MARGARET (Garrett’s mother)

60-70's she/her, white

Caustic, narcissistic therapist

JIMMY (Mary-Margaret’s boyfriend)

60-70's he/him, any race

Happy-go-lucky, lecherous

BETHY (Garrett’s step sister)

30-40's she/her, white

Santa Cruz earth mama, altruistic

CHAZ (Bethy’s husband)

30-40's he/him, any race

Smug, yoga bro


Please send resume and comediic or dramatic monologue.

title: AD: FEARLESS AUDITION TECHNIQUE | AUDITION WITH JOY | IN PERSON (NYC) AND ONLINE IN FEBRUARY AND MARCH
description:
The Art and the Audition with Karen Kohlhaas
New York, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Karen Kohlhaas
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Dear Actors,

I'm looking forward to these workshops!

FEARLESS AUDITION TECHNIQUE is

• A 10 point system for all kinds of auditions with sides—from self tape to in person

• Techniques for handling all of the non-acting moments of an audition with confidence and ease—slates, entrances, exits, and chit-chat

and most of all

• A positive, adventurous mindset that helps you be an artist in your auditions, beat perfectionism and negative self talk, and audition with actual JOY.

WHAT ACTORS ARE SAYING

"My friends have noticed a change in me, not just professionally, and it's partly because of the 'peace' your class has brought me. My auditioning has become stronger and my “Oh S***” moments are much fewer and farther between.
—MAYA LYNNE ROBINSON

"I just got a callback for the first audition I've had since your class and it made an extraordinary difference in both my performance and ability to be open to direction. And, best of all, the audition was really fun."
—ANNA KULL


NOW ENROLLING

NYC Weekend | FEARLESS AUDITION TECHNIQUE
February 21 & 22 | 9:15AM-1:15PM at Atlantic Acting School
Includes 3 weeks of followup
Tuition | $250
Full class description and how to apply | https://icont.ac/51dLE

4-Week Online Workshop | FEARLESS AUDITION TECHNIQUE
Wednesdays in March | Morning and Evening Available

You can also email classes@monologueaudition.com to receive the full class descriptions, ask questions, or to join my list to hear about the next classes and free events!

~Karen

DESCRIPTION
Public Relations Internship Opportunity at KSA

Are you passionate about media, entertainment, and storytelling? Are you eager to gain hands-on experience in publicity and public relations? KSA is seeking enthusiastic and driven interns to join our team.

As an intern at KSA, you’ll be actively involved in all aspects of publicity campaigns, from strategizing and writing press materials to pitching media, working events, and conducting research. Write and edit press materials, including media alerts and pitches.
Research and track media coverage, compile press clips, and identify opportunities.

Strong writing and communication skills.
Passion for media, entertainment, and public relations.

title: RIFFRAFF NYC AND ROGUE THEATER FESTIVAL PLAYFEST: CALL FOR SUBMISSIONS: I’M IN LOVE WITH AN IMMIGRANT AUGUST SHOWCASE
description:
RiffRaff NYC
New York, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Riff Raff
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION



RiffRaff NYC and Rogue Theater Festival invite playwrights to submit original short plays for our fourth festival showcase, I’m In Love With An Immigrant.

We welcome stories that explore love in all its forms: romantic, familial, platonic, cultural, or community love. Plays should center immigrant experiences in America and highlight the emotional bonds that shape belonging, identity, and home.

Submission Guidelines

Length: Plays must run 15–20 minutes

Cast Size: No more than four actors on stage

Theme: Stories must center on immigrant experiences in America connected to the theme I’m In Love With An Immigrant

Production Responsibility: If accepted, playwrights are responsible for casting, securing a director, and coordinating rehearsals (RiffRaff NYC producers are happy to assist if needed)

Participation Fee: $250, payable only if the play is accepted

Performance Dates: August 10–16

Venue: American Theatre of Actors

Awards & Opportunities

At the conclusion of the showcase, a panel of judges will present:

Best Play

Best Original Script

Best Director

Outstanding Performance Awards (3 recipients) – Recognizing exceptional acting, regardless of gender

Rogue Theater Festival Production Award – One selected piece will be invited to fully produce their play with the Rogue Theatre Festival at The Flea Theatre in 2027, participation fee waived

This marks RiffRaff NYC’s second collaboration with Rogue Theater Festival, continuing our shared mission of uplifting bold, diverse theatrical voices.

✉️ How to Submit

Email your 15–20 minute script (PDF) and a brief playwright bio to:

RiffRaff NYC
📧 riffraff.nyc@gmail.com
Subject Line: I’m In Love With An Immigrant – [Play Title] – [Playwright Name]

Submission Deadline: April 1st (with a possible extension)

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

RiffRaff NYC is a New York–based theatre and film company dedicated to championing immigrant artists and global perspectives. Through festivals, showcases, and original productions, RiffRaff creates platforms for underrepresented voices while building an international artistic community in the heart of NYC.

Rogue Theater Festival is an independent New York theatre festival committed to supporting bold, original work from emerging and established artists. Known for fostering creative risk and providing production opportunities beyond the festival itself, Rogue helps new plays and artists grow their work on New York stages.

Apr 1, 2026 -

BREAKDOWN


TWELFTH NIGHT


Equity video submission Instructions:


Please submit your headshot, resume and an unlisted Youtube or Vimeo link to your video audition for consideration.

Please prepare one of the Sides from the following Dropbox link: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo...
Playfulness, ease and confidence with heightened language are required for all roles.

Please do not attach audition tapes as files.

Please note if you sing or play any musical instruments.

The Equity video submission deadline is February 25th, 2026, at 5pm PT.

SEEKING:


The roles of Olivia, Viola and Sir Andrew have been precast.


[ORSINO AND AS CAST] Male-identifying. A man who doesn’t understand himself and maybe
doesn't even know there is a Self to understand. Growing up in a rarefied, privileged world has spun a cocoon of narcissism and self-indulgence around what is in fact a sensitive, highly intelligent, and kind man. Some part of him is dimly ready to be woken up.

[SEBASTIAN AND AS CAST] Male-identifying. Courageous, smart, compassionate. These qualities make him strangely attractive to everyone he meets. Sensitive to the point of being over-sensitive. Spontaneous and impulsive. His youth has the gift of accepting with complacent goodwill any situation as it comes, sometimes with an intense in-the-moment Presence, and sometimes with an infant’s lack of object-permanence.

[ANTONIO AND AS CAST] Male-identifying. Astonishingly brave, a little swashbuckling even. Has seen (and been the cause of) some horrifying violence, which out of love for Sebastian he dilutes or romanticizes, but the memory of and the potential for bloodshed are both there still. Loyal, capable of deep and utter devotion. Hopeless and even shy in his love for Sebastian, which he knows is not. returned and yet still is unable to help himself.

[MARIA AND AS CAST] Female-identifying. Intelligent, mischievous, merry, cheerful, always with a twinkle in the eye, and so she finds it very hard to endure Olivia’s enforced period of mourning. But she really is trying her best to be good. Salty and earthy, utterly in command. Like Toby, her joy and fun can turn mean on a dime, and she won’t lose a moment’s sleep over it. You might be laughing uproariously at something she’s just said only to suddenly realize the joke was on you.

[SIR TOBY BELCH AND AS CAST] Male-identifying. Immensely funny, witty, ranging from slapstick to deadpan. Occasionally cunning. Not a Falstaff, there is less expansiveness, less philosophy, more rapaciousness. Boisterous irresistible good humor and silliness that can turn into mean drunk quickly and unexpectedly. Never blustering, his improvisation is always masterful and in control. There’s a kind of desperateness in his insistent partying that partly comes from his addiction (like all addicts, he carries on long past the point of real pleasure) and partly is a kind of childish (but vital!) rebellion against Olivia’s mourning.

[MALVOLIO AND AS CAST] Any gender identity. Not a tyrannical gargoyle, not pinched and cruel, not joyless, not loveless. “Sad and civil”, which implies seriousness and self-control, but also empathy, or the capacity to hold space for others. Rather humorless, and they take their job very, *very* seriously. Their self-seriousness and rigorous application of themself to their work makes others see in them uppishness and pomposity (not totally unjustified), making them an easy and credulous target for cruel jokes. But from Malvolio's point of view, they're just doing their job (and doing it well) and they can’t understand why nobody else is doing theirs. Their aspiration for Olivia’s love is not entirely predatory/ambitious.

[FABIAN AND AS CAST] Any gender identity. An essentially un-serious person, laconic bordering on insolent, Tom Sawyer-ish in their desire to escape all work or responsibility. Very smart. Playing hooky is an art and being useless a philosophy. Their enjoyment of the sandbox/playground of life is infectious. If you’re planning a party you’d be like “Oh, know who would LOVE this? Fabian.” Witnessing the consequences of their actions is jarring for them.

[FESTE AND AS CAST] Any gender identity. Wise enough to play the fool. Something of the stray dog about them. Unashamed to sing for their supper but knows also how to keep some part of themself separate and unclaimed. Comfortable in any company because they are utterly at ease with being seen. Nothing to hide and nowhere to hide it anyway. Singing required.


SALARY

99 Seat Agreement $17.81 per hour

UNION

AEA

description:

US

CONTACT NAME

Brandon Copeland
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Position:

Full Stop Technical Director

Overview:

The Technical Director is responsible for working across the Full Stop brands with all team members, contractors, clients and IP holders. You will play a crucial role in overseeing and coordinating and leading all aspects of the technical production process. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that each technical aspects of the project runs smoothly from conception to completion, meeting artistic standards, budgetary constraints, and deadlines. You will collaborate closely with directors, designers, technical staff, performers, venues, IP Holders, clients and producers to bring the technical creative vision to life while managing the logistical details and overall vision.

Reporting Structure:

The Technical Director will report directly to the Director of Production. As a key member of Full Stop Productions team, this position will collaborate closely with the co-owners, clients, employees, contractors, vendors, stake holders, producers, designers, and other Creative Team members to achieve departmental and organizational goals.

Key Responsibilities:

· Technical Planning and Scheduling:

· Work closely with technical and creative teams, producers, venue, IP Holder’s, clients and other stakeholders to understand and contribute to the creative vision and technical requirements for each production.

· Develop and coordinate the overall, build, install/strike, rehearsal and operations schedules and timelines.

· Manage scheduling conflicts and ensure efficient use of resources, including venue space, equipment, and personnel.

· Technical Production Oversight:

· Create and modify technical drawings, build drawings, take offs, install packages, mark ups, and documentation

· Collaborate with the creative team, designers, shops, IP Holder’s and clients to execute technical elements of the production, including but not limited to scenic, props, rigging, lighting, audio, video, costumes, special effects, automation and more.

· Coordinate and oversee the integration of all technical elements into each project.

· Troubleshoot technical issues during all phases of the production and ensure that all technical elements are properly planned, installed, maintained and operated.

· Budget Management:

· Working with the producers and clients to develop and manage technical and creative budgets.

· Create RFP’s, bid sheets, and negotiate contracts with vendors, suppliers, and personnel to ensure cost-effective solutions for the production without compromising artistic integrity and vision.

· Monitor expenses throughout the process and propose and implement cost-saving measures or value engineering when necessary and appropriate.

· Logistics and Operations:

· Plan, attend and run production meetings, site visits, shop visits, installs, rehearsals, shows, strikes and, events as needed as the Technical Director, travel will be required

· Coordinate all logistical aspects of the production, including transportation, trucking, shipping, storage, lodging, and catering.

· Manage and document the procurement process, maintenance plans and all technical documentation required for the smooth operation of the production including but not limited to all technical elements, rehearsals, install and strikes, operations and logistics.

· Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations throughout the technical process, identifying and addressing potential hazards.

· Team Coordination:

· Working with the producers, to hire and supervise additional technical staff and crew as needed for varying projects

· Foster a collaborative and positive working environment, ensuring effective communication and teamwork among all technical team members.

· Lead production meetings, builds, installs and strikes for various projects including live shows, parades, museums, marketing activations, conventions, and more.

· Provide guidance and support to team members, addressing any concerns or challenges that arise during build, installation, rehearsals, operations and strike.

· Business Development

· Work closely with the Executive Producers to secure and finalize business deals on behalf of the Full Stop brands.

· Assist in building long term relationships on behalf of the Full Stop brands with new and existing clients

· Promote the company’s products, services and make suggestions for opportunities and new development

Qualifications and Skills:

· Bachelor’s degree in Technical Theater Production, Arts Management, or related field (or 5+ years of equivalent professional experience).

· Proven experience in technical management (touring, theme park or cruise ships preferred), with a strong understanding of the technical process from concept to performance and a familiarity with technical aspects of theatrical production, including rigging, stagecraft, lighting, sound, video and scenic, automation and special effects.

· Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize competing demands.

· Ability to interpret, review, and develop plans from technical drawings using AutoCAD; experience with Vectorworks or Rhino preferred but not required. Familiar with additional technical platforms including BIM workflows.

· Strong leadership, written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate, lead and guide the production while working with diverse teams and stakeholders.

· Knowledge of budgeting and financial management principles, with experience managing and tracking technical budgets and expenses.

· Highly organized with strong problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret and draft instructions and notes in various formats and software including but not limited to technical drawings, bid sheets, contracts and other business and technical documents.

· Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, often under pressure and tight deadlines.

· Flexibility and adaptability to work in a variety of situations and conditions.

· In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office, Asana, and file sharing platforms.

· Ability to work and live in Tampa Bay FL, with US Work Authorization

· Ability to travel worldwide for extended periods of time based on the technical needs of the production.

· Availability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as required by technical schedules.

· Physical ability to lift and move heavy equipment and set pieces, walk and stand for extended periods of time.

· Knowledge of union regulations and collective bargaining agreements (where applicable) is a plus.

· International technical knowledge is a plus

As a Technical Director, you will serve as a pivotal figure in bringing the clients artistic vision to life. Your combination of organizational, managerial, and technical skills will ensure the successful execution of each production, expanding the brand and quality of Full Stop Productions.

Travel:

The nature of the position will require travel. Travel expectations will vary based on the specific needs of projects, clients, or business development activities. Employees in this role should be prepared for both domestic and international travel, as necessary.

Pay and Benefit Structure:

· S. Work Authorization is required, we are not able to obtain visas or other work authorization for this position

· Annual Salary in USD based on experience.

· Payroll will be bi-weekly in arrears.

· 2 weeks of Paid Time Off (PTO) , plus designated company holidays, paid.

· If a holiday falls on a production related workday or weekend, then an alternate date will be selected

· Health Insurance

· Employer contribution to Medical, Eye and Dental plan.

To Apply:

Please submit your resume to: WorkWithUs@fullstoppro.com

title: SEEKING SINGERS/INSTRUMENTALISTS FOR OUTDOOR, SITE-SPECIFIC, NEW MUSICAL
description:
ECODISASTER Musical
Brooklyn , NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Madeline Wall
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION


CONTRACT:
12 Rehearsals and 4 performances
$200 stipend
non-union

PREPARATION:
Please email us a video (or link to a video) of you singing. If you play an instrument, please send us a video of you playing it.
In your email, please briefly introduce yourself.
If you have a role(s) you're particularly interested in, please say so.

PERSONNEL:
Will review submissions:

Director, Madeline Wall
Music Director, Lily White
Book and Lyrics Writer, Sarah Safford
Composer, Sean Ivy

ABOUT THIS PROJECT:
EcoDisaster in the Hundred Acre Wood

New Musical

100 years ago Winnie the Pooh and his friends were introduced in an English magazine. Since then they have been endlessly adapted and taken on countless reimaginings by readers around the world. Now, Washington Park in Brooklyn takes up the role of the Hundred Acre Woods. The familiar characters are older and the Forest is under threat from the impacts of climate change and an encroaching pipeline project. We see Winnie the Pooh and friends co-existing in a somewhat neglected habitat, their ‘retirement community’. They lovingly bicker and exchange grievances about their situation.


We’re looking for actors with strong musicianship. For this upcoming May 2026 production, we’ve envisioned a site-specific show where actors play instruments in a jug band as they traipse around Old Stone House and Washington Park - transforming it into the 100 Acre Wood!


Songs will be led by guitar, banjo, and piano, accompanied by instruments like washtub bass, washboard, jugs, spoons, buckets, and bottles. If you have another instrument you love playing (Concertina? Flute? Violin? Tuba?), we’d love to find a way to incorporate it into the score.

The play explores themes of aging and disability. The reality of this production dictates that actors must be able to walk, as well as climb stairs. But we’d love to build a cast that reflects Brooklyn’s diversity of ages and abilities. If you have limited mobility or are differently abled, don’t hesitate to apply - we will accommodate.

The project is in continual development and has a long life ahead of it as a touring production through NYC and beyond. We want to find a cast that is excited by the material both for its elements of literary nostalgia surrounding the original Winnie the Pooh books, and for their urgent passion to engage with the current environmental landscape.

Listed vocal types are flexible, and we’re very willing to adjust music to fit the cast’s vocal range.


SEEKING



Band Leader
Plays piano, guitar, or banjo. Drives the music for most songs.
Uses props to make sound effects including rain and thunderstorms.
Plays the character of CR Jr, 40-50’s, corporate type in two scenes.
Voices Christopher Robin Sr. in prologue

Pooh
Tenor/Baritone.
Character is a man, aged 50-60, but could be played by any gender or age.
Pooh has a compassionate soft side. Portly and arthritic. Enjoys simple pleasures and has trouble with abstract thinking and seeing beyond his own immediate needs.
Instrumentalist a plus

Piglet
Tenor/Alto.
Character is a young gender fluid person, but could be played by any gender or age.
They are small, agile and fast moving. Suffers from generalized anxiety related to perceived outside threats, imaginary and real.
Instrumentalist a plus

Rabbit
Tenor/Baritone.
Character is a middle-aged man, but could be played by any gender or age.
High energy, overachiever and control freak. Needs to keep busy. Efficient to a fault and expects the same of others.
Instrumentalist a plus


Eeyore
Bass/Baritone.
Character is a young man, but could be played by any gender or age.
Slow moving and chronically depressed. His depression is often played for laughs - so an actor with a quick sardonic wit is a plus.
Instrumentalist a plus

Roo

Meso/Soprano.
Character is a young woman, but could be played by any gender or age.
Energetic and on the spectrum; mostly uninterested in the concerns of older animals. A gymnast, rapper, and generally fun person.
Instrumentalist a plus

Owl
Soprano
Character is a Woman, age 50-60, but could be played by any gender or age.
Elder, and occasionally wiser, member of the community, able to read and orate, interested in current events. Suffers from hearing, vision and memory loss, and anxiety related to aging and the news she reads about climate crisis.
Doubles as Engineer #3 - 40’s - any gender. Sensitive and dreamy. Loves nature and animals.
Dance/Movement ability is a plus.
Instrumentalist a plus.



Ensemble Track 1
Any age, any gender. Dancer or strong mover. Puppeteering experience is a plus. They help guide the audience around the park and create sound and visual effects to help tell the story.
Plays Engineer #1. 40-50’s Woman. Authoritative and defensive about her role in a non-traditional job.
Plays Grandchild #1 - Early teens. Internet trend obsessed and high energy. They deliver comic relief.
Instrumentalist a plus.

Ensemble Track 2
Any age, any gender. Dancer or strong mover. Puppeteering experience is a plus. They help guide the audience around the park and create sound and visual effects to help tell the story.
Plays Engineer #2. 20-30’s - Man. Very invested in proving himself.
Plays Grandchild #2 - Preteen. Internet trend obsessed and high energy. They deliver comic relief.
Instrumentalist a plus.

DURATION

Apr 12, 2026 - May 31, 2026

SALARY

$200 stipend

title: SEASONAL STAFF
description:
Greenbrier Valley Theatre
Lewisburg, WV
US
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Seasonal Staff for Greenbrier Valley Theatre

We are looking for:

scenic painter/general technician

prop artisan/general technicial

head electrician

wardrobe assistant & summer camp TA

summer camp TA (shorter contract duration)

About Greenbrier Valley Theatre (GVT)

Greenbrier Valley Theatre is proud to be West Virginia’s State Professional Theatre, dedicated to producing high-quality live performances that enrich our community. Our 2026 season will consist of Ripcord, The Greenbrier Ghost, Tuesdays with Morrie, The Mousetrap, and Miracle on 34th Street: The Live Musical Radio Play and we are seeking creative and versatile employees to support both the technical and design aspects of our shows over a 8-month contract.


Key Responsibilities

Provide technical support during set construction, rehearsals, performances, and strikes, ensuring all equipment and stage elements are safely installed and maintained.

Assist in your department's execution of design elements according to production requirements and design specifications.

Collaborate with the Technical Director, directors, and design team to interpret design drawings and technical plans.

Maintain a clean, safe, and organized workshop and storage area for work and materials.

Monitor inventory and coordinate repairs or replacements as needed to support production demands.

Support load-ins, load-outs, and strikes during production runs, adapting to variable schedules that may include evenings, weekends, and peak production periods.

Work backstage as run crew for productions as assigned

Required Experience & Skills

Demonstrated experience in your desired department's skills, and/or general theatre production.

Proficiency in machine & hand sewing, carpentry, fabrication, and painting techniques with the ability to work with various materials. (as relevant to job type)

Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, and design plans.

Physical capability to lift, move, and construct sets and use of ladders & vertical mast lifts, including the ability to safely lift up to 50 lbs.

Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Flexibility to work variable hours, including evenings and weekends as production schedules demand.

Be able to successfully pass a background check.

Preferred Experience & Skills

A degree in Theatre, Design, or a related field is preferred.

Experience working in a professional theatre environment.

Knowledge of modern prop fabrication techniques and materials.

Familiarity with safety protocols and best practices in a technical theatre setting.

Employment Details

Salary range for this position is $500 per week for the 8-month contract

Out of town seasonal hires receive a private bedroom with a shared bathroom, living and kitchen space within walking distance of the theatre. Housing is furnished, and basic kitchen supplies and bedding are provided. There is access to complimentary laundry facilities and wifi.

A travel stipend of $150 will be offered for this position.

The contract begins April 13, 2026 and concludes on December 22, 2026.

This is a full-time position requiring a variable schedule to meet production demands, including day, weekend, and evening hours. Compensation on a standard 40-hour work week. Overtime is paid in accordance with state and federal law with managerial approval.

US work authorization is required.

All seasonal employees must have a valid drivers license and reliable transportation.



Apply

Visit https://sites.google.com/gvtheatre.org/gvt-employment/ for more details on all available positions.

To apply, please email seasonalartistsprogram@gvtheatre.org and include the position you’re applying for in the subject line. We ask that you apply for one position only.

Your application should include a brief cover letter sharing your interest in the role, a current resume, and three professional references. While not required, applicants are welcome to include links to a portfolio or personal website if they feel it supports their application.

The deadline to apply is March 8, 2026 at 5 PM EST.

No phone calls, please.

$500.00 – $500.00 per week

title: ASSISTANT COMPANY MANAGER – BRASS JAR PRODUCTIONS/ DRUNK SHAKESPEARE
description:
Brass Jar Productions
Brooklyn, NY
US
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION
Assistant Company Manager – Brass Jar Productions

Compensation: $55,000–$65,000 per year
Location: Remote (Strong preference for NYC, Chicago, DC, Phoenix, or Houston)
Work Schedule: Full time, 40 hours/week, primarily Mon–Fri
Start Date: Immediately

Brass Jar Productions, the team behind the hit comedy Drunk Shakespeare, is seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Assistant Company Manager to support our growing national operations team.

As our company expands across multiple cities and productions, this role plays a critical part in ensuring our people systems, contracts, and documentation remain clear, compliant, and scalable. You’ll work closely with the National Company Manager and support leadership across venues to keep day-to-day operations running smoothly.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys building systems, supporting managers, and working at the intersection of people, process, and live entertainment.

Who You Are

You’re an operations-minded professional who thrives on organization, follow-through, and clarity. You enjoy managing details, tracking moving pieces, and supporting teams across locations. You’re comfortable handling sensitive information, juggling multiple priorities, and communicating clearly with a wide range of stakeholders.

You’re not looking to be the loudest voice in the room — you’re looking to be the person who makes sure nothing falls through the cracks.

Must-Haves



2+ years of experience in company management, operations, HR administration, or a related role






Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail






Strong written and verbal communication






Comfort working across multiple cities and time zones






Ability to manage confidential information with discretion






Proven ability to track deadlines, documentation, and workflows






Comfort reporting to senior leadership and supporting managers



Bonus Points



Experience in live entertainment, theatre, hospitality, or venue-based operations






Familiarity with union environments or collective bargaining agreements






Experience supporting large, distributed teams






Strong spreadsheet and documentation skills



What You’ll Do

The Assistant Company Manager supports the National Company Manager in maintaining the operational backbone of a multi-city live entertainment company.

Key responsibilities include:




Preparing and tracking cast, crew, and manager contracts






Supporting onboarding and offboarding processes across cities






Maintaining accurate records related to employment, agreements, and compliance






Assisting with CBA documentation, tracking, and updates






Serving as a first point of contact for routine manager questions






Coordinating paperwork, deadlines, and approvals across departments






Supporting process improvements to reduce administrative load and errors






Assisting with special projects related to staffing, systems, and operations




This role is operational and execution-focused, not creative or disciplinary.

What This Role Is (and Is Not)

This role is:




Hands-on and detail-driven






Supportive of managers and leadership






Central to maintaining consistency as the company scales




This role is not:




A creative or casting role






A scheduling decision-maker






A senior leadership position






An HR disciplinarian



Compensation & Benefits



$55,000–$65,000 annual salary (based on experience)






Company-sponsored health insurance (or equivalent stipend)






Paid time off






Complimentary tickets to Drunk Shakespeare






Opportunity to grow with a national, expanding live entertainment company



Location

This role is remote, but we strongly prefer candidates based in or near one of our current markets:
NYC, Chicago, DC, Phoenix, or Houston.

To Apply

Email jobs@brassjar.com with
[Your Name – Assistant Company Manager] in the subject line.

Please include:




A resume highlighting relevant experience






A brief note describing your interest in the role



About Us

Brass Jar Productions is the producer of Drunk Shakespeare, a critically acclaimed comedy playing in multiple cities across the U.S., blending classic literature with irreverent humor and immersive bar settings. We operate a growing portfolio of live productions and venues and are building the infrastructure to support our next phase of expansion.

Learn more at drunkshakespeare.com.

DURATION

Feb 2, 2026 -

SALARY

$55,000.00 – $65,000.00 per year

title: PODCAST SOCIAL MEDIA PRODUCER
description:
Dream Three
New York, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Jennifer Hanley
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Please apply using the link:
https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/dreamthree/24b0c5a6-d77f-4d0b-a65e-e12824035e91?utm_source=Playbill

ROLE OVERVIEW

Dream Three multi-platform story studio creating content across film, TV, theater, audio, publishing, and immersive media. Our podcast division produces shows that spark cultural conversations—content for people who find community in the things they love.

We're looking for a Social Media Producer who doesn't treat social as an afterthought. You'll have a seat at the creative table working closely with producers, talent, and the production team from concept through delivery.

WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN THIS ROLE

• Social content that feels intentional, not extracted—because you shaped it upstream.

• A consistent, on-brand content calendar that publishes on time—every time.

• Clear trajectory toward 100K followers with documented learnings on what's working.

• A repeatable system where great podcast conversations naturally become great social content.

WHO YOU ARE

• You think in clips before anyone hits record. You're not just someone with ideas—you're someone who ships. You can pitch a concept in a planning meeting and have it posted by end of week.

• You move fast but care deeply about craft, community, and the details that make content feel authentic rather than algorithmic. You understand fandom and pop culture—not because you've studied it, but because you've lived it.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Creative Partnership: Work closely with producers and talent to shape content with social in mind from the start. Bring a social-first perspective to creative conversations.

• Content Production + Coordination: Manage a small team of short-form video editors. Create clear briefs with creative direction. Oversee timelines and ensure deliverables are on-brand and ready to post.

• Calendar + Execution: Own the social media calendar across all platforms. Coordinate releases with episode drops, guest promotions, and cultural moments. Ensure consistent, on-time publishing.

• Growth + Experimentation: Develop and test content formats, hooks, and series ideas. Track trends, sounds, and platform shifts. Iterate based on what's working.

• Analytics + Optimization: Track performance metrics and present clear weekly reports. Use data to inform creative decisions and editor direction.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

• 2+ years in social media production, content creation, or a similar role (podcast, creator, or entertainment experience strongly preferred).

• Proven track record of executing—not just ideating. Show us things you've shipped.

• Deep fluency in short-form platforms (TikTok, Reels, Shorts) and what performs on each.

• Ability to give clear, constructive creative direction to editors.

• Strong instincts for hooks, pacing, and social-first storytelling.

• Highly organized—able to manage multiple deliverables without dropping balls.

• Genuine connection to fandom and pop culture. We can teach tools; we can't teach passion.

BONUS POINTS

• Experience working with talent on promotional content and social collaborations.

• Background in live events, conventions, or experiential content.

• Experience building or refining production workflows and systems.

• A personal fandom you're genuinely passionate about (we'll ask).

TOOLS YOU’LL USE

• Planning & Collaboration: Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom, Asana, Frame.io, Agorapulse

• Tracking: Airtable, Sheets

• File Sharing: Dropbox

THE DETAILS

• Hours: 15–20 hours/week to start, with flexibility to scale based on production cycles and live events.

• Location: Hybrid, with regular meetings in Manhattan.

• Travel: Occasional travel for events and content production.

• Contract: Initial 90-day evaluation period with potential for ongoing engagement.

• Compensation: Commensurate with experience.

• Start: Immediate availability preferred.

• Work Authorization: Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

DURATION

Feb 16, 2026 -

SALARY

$25.00 – $45.00 per hour
HOW TO APPLY
APPLY BY EMAIL

4c43682b-ad02-4a26-8f3c-684181a7c879…

BREAKDOWN

Depot Theatre 2026 Season

The Depot Theatre encourages and actively seeks actors of all Ethnicities, Nationalities and Gender. The Depot Theatre strives to cultivate an inclusive environment which welcomes differences of ethnicity, religion, sexuality, income, or any other divisions with generosity and openness among its artists, audiences, leaders, and community. Through support and understanding of our differences, we can recognize our commonalities. The Depot Theatre encourages performers of all ethnicities, races, gender identities, ages, body types, and abilities to audition.

When a gender is included in a character description, it refers only to the gender identity and/or presentation of that character as scripted by the playwright and not that of the performer

TICK, TICK...BOOM!
Director: Shawn Churchman
Musical Director: Aaron Jodoin
Rehearsals begin: June 15, 2026
Performances: June 25, 2026 - July 12, 2026

SYNOPSIS: Tick, Tick… Boom! follows Jonathan Larson, a young, fiercely driven composer racing against the clock as he approaches 30 and desperately tries to break into the New York theatre world before time—and his chances—run out. While juggling his diner job, a make-or-break workshop for his sci-fi musical, and the unraveling relationships with his girlfriend and best friend, Jonathan feels the pressure mounting from every direction. But when life delivers an emotional wake-up call, he discovers that the real ticking isn’t about career deadlines—it’s about love, loss, and the fire that pushes an artist to create against all odds.

SEEKING:


JONATHAN: (Male, 25 - early 30s) Dynamic, charismatic leading man. Struggling East Village
composer turning 30; smart and likeable, extremely passionate and determined; edgily ironic and irreverent and a little self-involved. Strong rock voice. Tenor. Vocal Range (middle C is C4): A2 – A4 (two octaves)

MICHAEL: (Male, 25 - early 30s) Jonathan's roommate and best friend. A gay business professional with an artist's soul. Career-minded and image-conscious but also supporting of and caring toward Jonathan. Soulful and devoted, but secretive. Doubles several additional character roles. Strong rock voice. Tenor. Vocal Range (middle C is C4): Bb2 – G4

SUSAN: (Female, 25 - early 30s) Jonathan's girlfriend. A compelling personality in her own right, she is both nurturing, loving and supportive but also growing increasingly frustrated with Jonathan's preoccupation and lack of commitment. This track doubles several additional character roles. A dancer. Mezzo-Soprano. Vocal Range (middle C is C4): Strong belt Ab3 to D5

INCIDENT AT OUR LADY OF PERPETUAL HELP
Director: Ginna Hoben
Rehearsals begin: July 13, 2026
Performances: July 23, 2026 - August 9, 2026

SYNOPSIS: Incident at Our Lady of Perpetual Help is a fast-paced, heartwarming comedic play that follows 19-year-old Linda O’Shea as she narrates the hilariously disastrous day when her attempt to give her younger sister “the talk” spirals completely out of control. Set in a tight-knit 1970s Irish Catholic community, the family’s private conversation is overheard by the parish’s most fearsome gossip, sending rumors flying and putting the O’Sheas’ reputation—and their sanity—on the line. As Linda tries to retell and reclaim the events of the day, with her family chiming in to correct her version of the story, the play becomes a joyful, chaotic celebration of family, faith, and the fine art of surviving small-town scandal.

SEEKING:

LINDA O’SHEA: (Female, 19-years old) Linda is highly intelligent, caring, and curious. She alternates between thinking she knows everything and thinking she knows nothing. Responsible and rarely impetuous.

JOSEPHINE ‘JO’ O’SHEA: (Female, late 40s, early 50s) Jo juggles more plates than Cirque de
Soleil. A great mom who defines multi-tasking. She's also a little more emotional and prone to
outbursts than usual because, well…you’ll see.

BECKY O’SHEA: (Female, 13-years old) Becky is an unusual child. Bright and verbal. Full of energy and a crazy-huge imagination. She speaks quickly, not unlike some of the characters in the movies she loves, like "His Girl Friday."

THERESA ‘TERRI’ CHARMICHAEL: (Female, late 50s) Terri is definitely going through a rough
patch, but she is not a depressive or phlegmatic. Think Thelma Ritter or Eve Arden, with a touch of Dorothy Parker. Fast talker.

TRACK 1: (Male, 50s) This track will double as three roles - Mike O’Shea (50s)/ Father Lovett (50s)/ Betty Heckenbach (50s): MIKE is loud, loyal, and single-task oriented. His definition of a father is: Breadwinner and disciplinarian. Lousy listener. / FATHER LOVETTT is an old school, Catholic priest. Egotistical, imperious, and pampered. Unused to any kind of pushback from parishioners or anyone else for that matter. / There is a BETTY HECKENBACH in everyone's life. She's right up there with death and taxes—only less fun. Even if the role is played by a man, it will be played absolutely straight—no winking or flamboyance. Just a homely, judgmental, middle-aged woman sticking her big puss into other people's business.

RING OF FIRE
Director: Michael Santora
Music Director: TBD
Rehearsals begin: August 10, 2026
Performances: August 20, 2026 - September 6, 2026

SYNOPSIS: Ring of Fire is a spirited, toe-tapping musical that celebrates the life, legacy, and music of Johnny Cash by threading together his greatest hits to tell a sweeping American story. Rather than following a traditional plot with one main character, the show uses a cast of performers to trace the arc of Cash’s journey—from humble beginnings in the Arkansas cotton fields, through love, struggle, faith, rebellion, heartbreak, and redemption—while capturing the grit, humor, and soul that defined him. Through iconic songs like “I Walk the Line,” “Folsom Prison Blues,” and “Ring of Fire,” the musical becomes a vibrant portrait of resilience and the power of music to carry us through every season of life.

SEEKING:

TRENNA: (Female, 20s-40s) Trenna functions as the primary female voice of the ensemble—warm, intuitive, and grounded. She often embodies the perspective of June Carter Cash, though not as a literal portrayal. Her presence brings emotional balance, humor, and vitality to the storytelling. She is capable of both tender vulnerability and playful charm, anchoring many of the show’s emotional arcs. Vocal Range: Flexible alto to mezzo; strong lead and harmony skills. Instruments: Acoustic guitar (preferred), basic percussion.

JASON: (Male, 20s-40s) Jason often carries central narrative threads tied to young Johnny Cash’s spirit—hopeful, yearning, searching. While not a direct impersonation, he channels youthful energy, earnest charm, and emotional clarity. He functions as one of the musical anchors of the ensemble and frequently leads transitions between thematic segments. Vocal Range: Tenor/baritone with strong lead capability. Instruments: Acoustic guitar, hand percussion, auxiliary percussion.

EDDIE: (Male, 20s-40s) Eddie embodies the raw drive and rock-leaning edge of Johnny Cash’s
influence. He often brings intensity, swagger, and musical grit to the ensemble. A dynamic presence, he helps fuel the show’s rhythmic engine and frequently leads the more energetic or heavily guitar-driven numbers. Vocal Range: Tenor/baritone with commanding lead voice. Instruments: Acoustic guitar, electric guitar, various percussion.

DAVID: (Male, 20s-40s) David is the ensemble’s multi-instrumental backbone, bringing texture, color, and authenticity to the musical landscape. He often embodies the show’s rural, roots-driven heart. His character presence tends to be calm, warm, and subtly humorous—someone who helps tie the ensemble together musically and emotionally. Vocal Range: Flexible tenor/baritone with strong harmonies. Instruments: Electric guitar, banjo, mandolin, fiddle.

MARK: (Male, 20s-40s) Mark provides the musical foundation—steady, grounded, resonant. He often embodies a storyteller or observer role, offering reflective warmth and a grounded presence within the ensemble. While not always the focal soloist, his contributions are essential to the show’s structure and feel. Vocal Range: Baritone/bass-baritone; strong blend and occasional solo lines. Instruments: Bass (upright preferred; electric acceptable).


SALARY

Independent Theatre Contract $480 weekly minimum - plus housing, travel

UNION

AEA

description:
BOND New York
New York, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Brian Letendre
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION
Why not use your down time to get your real estate license virtually and start making money to not only get you through these uncertain times but give you financial flexibility to enhance your skills. Voice lessons? New headshots? Self-Tapes? As a three time Broadway veteran, I'm here to tell you there is a solution. I’m here to share my journey from Broadway to Broker and how I have thrived in both so I never had to fall back on anything.

BOND New York truly provides a flexible, supportive environment needed for artists who are looking to have financial independence while pursuing a career in the arts. It doesn’t have to be one or the other!

Join me for my free virtual event Saturday, February 28th, 2026 at 5:00 PM EDT, to find out how you can have a parallel career in real estate without having to compromise your artistic pursuits. I'm doing it…so can you!

title: SCENIC PROJECTION DESIGNER FOR AN ORIGINAL SHOW, SPIRIT OF THE GAME: THE ULTIMATE MUSICAL - MAY 14-17 IN NYC
description:
Ultimate Musical LLC
New York, NY
US

CONTACT NAME

Philip Vlahakis
JOB DETAILS
DESCRIPTION

Spirit of the Game: The Ultimate Musical is seeking a Scenic Projection Designer to join our creative team for a non-equity showcase production at Asylum NYC. Rehearsals begin April 22, 2026 and run each weekday from 10 am to 3 pm through May 8. Tech and dress rehearsals are planned for May 12 and 13 with performances running May 14-17. The Scenic Projection Designer would join production meetings before the start of the rehearsal schedule for planning and initial design discussions, and be available for some portion of the rehearsal schedule to adapt and refine designs given the developmental nature of this new work. This new musical blends athleticism, humor, and heart, and we’re looking for a designer who can help build a dynamic visual world through projection including scenes on the island of Crete in Greece and athletic fields in different locations where the sport of ultimate frisbee will come to life.




Responsibilities include:

Designing and implementing scenic projections that support storytelling, tone, and pacing
Collaborating closely with the director, lighting designer, and creative team
Developing projection concepts for environments, transitions, and stylized moments of play and motion
Preparing and delivering all projection media and documentation for rehearsals and tech
Participating in production meetings, rehearsals as needed, and technical rehearsals

Qualifications:

Experience designing projections for theatre, dance, or live performance
Strong visual storytelling skills and a collaborative working style
Proficiency with projection design software and media workflows (e.g., QLab, Isadora, After Effects, or similar)
Ability to work within production timelines and adapt to evolving creative needs
Interest in movement-driven or athletic performance a plus

Please submit a brief cover note and portfolio or samples of relevant work to info@ultimatemusical.com

Join us in bringing this high-energy, original musical to life through bold and imaginative projection design.
DURATION

Mar 2, 2026 - May 17, 2026

SALARY

$2,000.00 – $2,000.00 per gig

APPLY BY EMAIL

BREAKDOWN

Maine State Music Theatre 2026 Season




HAIRSPRAY – THE MUSICAL

Book by: Thomas Meehan and Marc O’Donnell

Music by: Marc Shaiman

Lyrics by: Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman

Based on the New Line Cinema film, written and directed by John Waters

Director & Choreographer: Kenny Ingram

Music Director: David Fiorello

First Rehearsal for MSMT: May 29, 2026

Opening: June 4, 2026

Closing: June 20, 2026


Note: This show is a co-production with Fulton Theatre Company, Lancaster, PA. This production is fully cast, and we are not seeking performers for HAIRSPRAY at this EPA.


Tracy Turnblad - ROLE IS CAST. Our story's unsuspecting protagonist. Confident, talented, and incredibly determined. A romantic with a good heart and desire to cut up the dance floor. Always on top of the latest trends. Tracy Turnblad is a young lady with big hair and an even bigger personality!She is the hero of our story, and she is sweet but also strong in her convictions. She is bigger in size than the other girls, but she isn't shy about it - she can still dance with the best of them! An excellent singer and dancer, who has wonderful stage presence and can easily capture the audience's hearts.18+ to play high school age, white. Gender: Female Presenting. Mezzo-Soprano With a StrongTheatre/Pop Belt. Vocal range top: G5. Vocal range bottom: G3

Corny Collins - ROLE IS CAST. The charismatic host of the Corny Collins' Show. Good looking and smooth talking, he is a genuinely nice guy both on and off camera. 25 – 35, white. Gender: Male Presenting. Strong Pop Singer, High Baritone. Vocal range top: A4. Vocal range bottom: D3

Edna Turnblad - ROLE IS CAST. Tracy's big and blonde mother. She is a working housewife who has lost her confidence and dream to be a plus-size clothing designer. Boisterous and commanding. Often played by a male presenting performer. 40 – 55, white. Gender: Male Presenting. Bass-Baritone. Vocal range top: G5. Vocal range bottom: F3

Penny Pingleton - ROLE IS CAST. Tracy's best friend and dorky sidekick. Not the brightest girl, but she has good intentions. Bursting to get free of her mother's dominating control, she falls for Seaweed with childlike curiosity. 18+ to play high school age, white. Gender: Female Presenting. Strong High Belt, Contemporary Theatre/Pop Voice. Vocal range top: G5. Vocal range bottom: A3

Velma Von Tussle - ROLE IS CAST. Amber's mother and the director of Corny Collin's show. She is a devious taskmaster and snobby racist. The former Miss Baltimore Crabs will go to any length to ensure her daughter is the next big thing. 45 – 55, white. Gender: Female Presenting. Mezzo-Soprano With Strong Belt Mix. Vocal range top: E5. Vocal range bottom: G3

Amber Von Tussle - ROLE IS CAST. Link's girlfriend and Tracy's nemesis. She is pretty, shallow, snobby, and racist. Can't dance but is expected to win Miss Baltimore Hairspray. Always feels the need to be the center of attention. Female, 18+ to play high school age, white. Gender: Female Presenting. Mezzo-Soprano. Vocal range top: F5. Vocal range bottom: A3

Link Larkin - ROLE IS CAST. The star heartthrob on Corny Collins' show. He is extremely attractive and talented. Hoping to get his big break with a recording contract, he unexpectedly falls for Tracy. 18+ to play high school age, white. Gender: Male Presenting. Tenor With Strong Falsetto. Vocal range top: A5. Vocal range bottom: G3

Seaweed J. Stubbs - ROLE IS CAST. Tracy's classmate and friend, who is discriminated against due to his skin color. He is cocky but surprisingly lovable. Talented in song and dance. He falls for Penny. 18+ to play high school age, Black. Gender: Male Presenting. Excellent Soulful, Pop Singer - High Tenor. Vocal range top: D5. Vocal range bottom: F3


Little Inez - ROLE IS CAST. Seaweed's little sister. 18+ to play early teens, Black. Gender: Female Presenting. Soulful Voice with Strong Belt Mix. Vocal range top: F5. Vocal range bottom: G3

Motormouth Maybelle - ROLE IS CAST. Seaweed and Little Inez's mother, she also appears as the Guest DJ on the Corny Collin's Negro Day show. Big, blonde, beautiful and proud of it. She is sassy and confident. 40 – 50, Black. Gender: Female Presenting. Alto With High Belt. Vocal range top: E5. Vocal range bottom: F3

Wilbur Turnblad - ROLE IS CAST. Tracy's simpleminded and kind father. He owns a joke shop andsupports his daughter in spite of everything else. He also loves his wife, Edna, very much. 40 – 55, white. Gender: Male Presenting. Baritone With Strong Falsetto. Vocal range top: A5. Vocal range bottom: A3

Prudy Pingleton - ROLE IS CAST. Penny's strict mother. Very conservative, controlling, and closed minded. 40 – 55, white. Gender: Female Presenting. Mezzo-Soprano With Character Belt. Vocal range top: B4. Vocal range bottom: D4




1776

Book by Peter Stone

Music & Lyrics by Sherman Edwards

Based on a concept by Sherman Edwards

Director: Amber Mak

Choreographer: Christopher Page-Sanders

Musical Director: Jason Wetzel

First Rehearsal: June 6, 2026

Opening: June 25, 2026

Closing: July 11, 2026


SEEKING:

JOHN ADAMS: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. Delegate from Massachusetts. John is a dutiful husband. Opinionated, passionate, and a bit boisterous, he wears his age with pride. Starving for independence from England. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 35 -50. Vocal range top: F#4. Vocal range bottom: C3

ROGER SHERMAN: Delegate from Connecticut. A coffee drinker with a penchant for hyperactivity, Sherman is a simple and balding cobbler. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 50-60. Vocal range top: Bb4. Vocal range bottom: C3

ROBERT LIVINGSTON: Delegate from New York. Recently a father, Livingston's disposition has become one of humility and graciousness. He has changed considerably over the years. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 25-35. Vocal range top: F4. Vocal range bottom: Bb2

BENJAMIN FRANKLIN: Delegate from Pennsylvania. Franklin is intelligent, well-traveled, and pleasantly cunning. A jolly and admirable fellow with whom one would desire to have a friendship. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 60 to 70. Vocal range top: Eb4. Vocal range bottom: Ab2

JOHN DICKINSON: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. Delegate from Pennsylvania. A thin, hawkish gentleman. He is sharp-tongued and a touch detestable. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30 - 45. Vocal range top: E4. Vocal range bottom: A2

RICHARD HENRY LEE: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. Delegate from Virginia, Lee is a willowy aristocrat. His flamboyancy is intoxicating and borderline infuriating. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 40 - 55. Vocal range top: G4. Vocal range bottom: C3

THOMAS JEFFERSON: Delegate from Virginia. Though noticeably tall, Jefferson is mild-mannered and sweet. Along with being a well read man, he is very much in love with his wife. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 25 - 35. Vocal range top: G4. Vocal range bottom: C3

EDWARD RUTLEDGE: Delegate from South Carolina. Despite his good looks, Rutledge is haunting and somewhat ominous as the youngest member of the Continental Congress. There is a serpent-like quality to him. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 25 - 35. Vocal range top: A4. Vocal range bottom: C3

ABIGAIL ADAMS: Loving wife to John Adams. Intelligent, quick-witted, and talented with a pen, Abigail is a radiant and shapely beauty. Every bit as bright as her husband. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 25 - 35. Vocal range top: F5. Vocal range bottom: Db4

DR. JOSIAH BARTLETT: Delegate from NH. Bartlett practiced medicine for over 40 years. During that time, he promoted wellness practices, including diet, exercise, fresh air, and a contented mind. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 40s Vocal Range: Any

SAMUELA CHASE: Delegate from MD. Nicknamed Old Bacon Face due to his proneness for a facial flush when angered or excited or due to his general ruddy complexion, or both. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30s. Vocal Range: Any

DR. LYMAN HALL: Delegate from GA. Born in CT, graduated from Yale; physician, clergyman, statesman. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 40s. Vocal Range: Any

JOHN HANCOCK: President of the Congress, from MA. He was one of the wealthiest men in the Colonies. He began his political career in Boston as a protégé of Samuel Adams. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 40s. Vocal Range: Any

JOSEPH HEWES: Delegate from NC. Born in Princeton to Quaker parents. A shipping merchant, appointed to the Naval Board and the Marine Committee, which laid the foundation for the US Navy. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30s - 40s. Vocal Range: Any

STEPHEN HOPKINS: Male Presenting. 60+. Delegate from Rhode Island. Hopkins' drinking has led to an appearance befitting of the 2nd oldest in the Continental Congress. He has a dirty old man playfulness about him. Vocal range: C3–Eb4.

COL. THOMAS MCKEAN: Male Presenting. 40s. Delegate from Delaware. McKean is florid and likable with a charming, yet commanding, Scottish brogue. Vocal range: C3–Eb4.

MARTHA JEFFERSON: Female Presenting. 20s. Thomas Jefferson's very-much-in-love wife. Her looks are striking, her dancing delightful, and her humor appealing. She doesn't shy away from a good time. Joy radiates from her. Vocal range: Bb3–D5.

COURIER: Male Presenting. 20s. Any ethnicity. The message runner between General Washington's army and the Continental Congress. He has witnessed the hardships of war firsthand, although his innocent disposition and appearance may imply otherwise. Vocal range: C3–Db4.

LEWIS MORRIS: Male Presenting. 30s. Delegate from NY. Morris was born at his politically connected family's estate, Morrisania, presently part of Bronx County.

REV. JOHN WITHERSPOON: Male Presenting. 50s. Delegate from NJ. A Scottish American Presbyterian minister, educator, farmer, and slaveholder, he embraced the concepts of Scottish common-sense realism. President of the College of New Jersey, he was influential in the development of the United States’ national character.

JAMES WILSON: Male Presenting. 30s. Delegate from PA. Born in Scotland, he was a legal scholar, jurist, and statesman. A leading legal theorist, he was one of the first four Associate Justices appointed to the Supreme Court by George Washington.

CAESAR RODNEY: Male Presenting. 40s–50s. Delegate from DE. He was an officer of the Delaware militia during the French and Indian War and the American Revolutionary War. He was tormented throughout his life by asthma, and his adult years were plagued by a facial cancer.


GEORGE READ: Male Presenting. 40s. Delegate from DE. Described as “tall...gracefully formed, with pleasing features and lustrous brown eyes. His manners were dignified.... He commanded entire confidence.” Also, “his legal abilities are said to be very great, but his powers of oratory are fatiguing and tiresome to the last degree; his voice is feeble and his articulation so bad that few can have patience to attend him.”

CHARLES THOMSON: Male Presenting. 40s. Secretary of the Congress. Irish born, a Latin teacher and translator. As secretary, Thomson chose what to include in the official journals of the Continental Congress (which caused some criticism and disputes).

ANDREW MCNAIR: Male Presenting. 60s. Congressional custodian. Served as official ringer of the Liberty Bell from 1759 to 1776, and he likely rang it to announce independence on July 8.

LEATHER APRON / PAINTER: Male Presenting. 20s. A working man.




FROZEN

Music & Lyrics by Kristen Anderson-Lopez & Robert Lopez

Book by Jennifer Lee

Based on the Disney film written by Jennifer Lee and directed by Chris Buck & Jennifer Lee.

Director & Choreographer: Marc Robin

Musical Director: Brian Cimmet

First Rehearsal: June 27, 2026

Opening: July 16, 2026

Closing: August 1, 2026


SEEKING:

Elsa: Future Queen of Arendelle and Anna’s older sister; born with magical powers, isolates herself from others out of fear. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: Mid 20s – Early 30s. Vocal range top: Eb5. Vocal range bottom: E3

Anna: Princess of Arendelle and Elsa’s younger sister; an eternal optimist who longs to be loved and to connect with other people. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: Early 20s – Mid 30s. Vocal range top: E5. Vocal range bottom: G3

Kristoff: Hardworking ice harvester with a prickly exterior that hides a big heart. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 20s – 30s. Vocal range top: Bb4. Vocal range bottom: A2

Hans: Prince of the Southern Isles and youngest of thirteen brothers; charming and ambitious. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: Mid 20s – 30s. Vocal range top: A4. Vocal range bottom: A2

Olaf: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. Magical snowman with a childlike innocence. Gender: Any Gender. Age: 20s – 40s. Vocal range top: Eb5. Vocal range bottom: E3

Sven: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. Kristoff’s fiercely loyal reindeer best friend. Gender: Any Gender. Age: 20s – 40s

Weselton: Duke from a neighboring kingdom; chauvinistic, impolite, and judgmental. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30s -50s. Vocal Range Top: A4. Vocal Range Bottom: F3

Young Anna: ROLE IS CAST. Younger princess of Arendelle with youthful exuberance; fun-loving troublemaker; mesmerized by her sister’s magic. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 7 to 10 years old. Vocal range top: E5. Vocal range bottom: Bb3

Young Elsa: ROLE IS CAST. Elder princess of Arendelle with magical powers; obedient daughter; protective sister. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 9 -12 years old. Vocal range top: E5. Vocal range bottom: A3




COME FROM AWAY

Book, Music, and Lyrics by Irene Sankoff & David Hein

Director: Mark Johnson

Choreographer: Kelly Bolick

Musical Director: Harry Collins

First Rehearsal: July 18, 2026

Opening: August 6, 2026

Closing: August 22, 2026


SEEKING:

Claude & others: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. The gregarious and well-liked Mayor of Gander, Newfoundland, Claude loves his work, the townspeople and his daily traditions, but he's never had to deal with a crisis of this magnitude before. Doubles as Derm and Brenda’s Brother, Eddie. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 40 to 60. Vocal range top: G4. Any Ethnicity

Bonnie & others: A no-nonsense mother of three, Bonnie is the head of the Gander area SPCA. When she discovers animals are trapped on the planes, she stops at nothing to ensure their safety - but in frustration, she often lashes out at those around her. Doubles as Martha. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 30 to 40. Vocal range top: B4. Any Ethnicity

Beulah & others: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. The head of the Gander Legion, with a firefighter son, who walks Hannah to her church and prays with her. Doubles as Delores. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 40 to 60. Vocal range: Mezzo with belt up to D. Any Ethnicity

Oz & others: The quirky constable in the two-person Gander police force. When the town's population suddenly doubles, Oz helps out in unexpected ways. Doubles as Joey, Customs Officer, Mr. Michaels, Terry, Matty, Rabbi, and Head Cardiologist. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30 to 50. Vocal range top: G4. Any Ethnicity

Janice & others: An eager new local TV reporter, Janice is thrown into the deep end on her first day. Initially naïve about the world, Janice must face the pain and confusion around her. Doubles as Britney and Flight Attendant. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 20 to 30. Vocal range top: E5. Any Ethnicity

Beverly/Annette & others: Beverly: The first female captain for American Airlines Pilot, Beverly Bass has always loved flying, when her world suddenly changes. Annette: A schoolteacher at Gander Academy with an active fantasy life. Doubles as Reporter. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 50 to 60. Vocal range top: C#5. Any Ethnicity

Diane & others: A traditional divorcee from Texas, who is terrified that her son may have been flying at the time of the attacks. When she finds out that he's safe, she's given a new lease on life and discovers a wilder more carefree side of herself. Doubles as Crystal and Brenda. Gender: Female Presenting. Age: 50 to 60. Vocal range top: C#5. Vocal range bottom: A3. Any Ethnicity

Nick/Doug & others: Nick: An English oil engineer who is focused on his work, Nick's life is turned upside down when he falls for Diane. Doug: An Air Traffic Controller, married to Bonnie, who tries to help his wife and the animals. Doubles as Officer Stephenson, and Male Townsperson. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 50 to 60. Vocal range top: E4. Any Ethnicity

Kevin T/Garth & others: Kevin T: The head of an environmental energy company in Los Angeles, Kevin was on vacation with his boyfriend (and secretary, also named Kevin), when they are stranded in Gander. Inspired by the town's generosity, Kevin creates the Pay It Forward Foundation. Garth: The head of the local union, representing the Bus Drivers. Doubles as President Bush. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30 to 50. Vocal range top: G4. Any Ethnicity

Kevin J/Ali & others: Kevin J: Kevin's boyfriend and secretary. Sarcastic and unhappy, he wants to leave as soon as possible. Ali: An Egyptian man traveling to America who experiences isolation and Islamophobia but who finds a connection to Beulah. Doubles as Dwight. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 30 to 50. Vocal range: B2-G4. Middle Eastern

Hannah & others: ROLE IS CAST. SEEKING UNDERSTUDY ONLY. The mother of a firefighter in Manhattan, Hannah waits for news about her son and is comforted by Beulah. Doubles as Margie and Mickey. Gender: Female. presenting. Age: 40 to 60. Vocal range top: E5. Black

Bob & others: A hardened New Yorker, Bob is suspicious of where he's landed, fearing that it's World War 3, that someone is going to shoot him and steal his wallet - but instead, he ends up losing his New York jadedness. Doubles as Muhumuza and Captain Bristol. Gender: Male Presenting. Age: 20 to 40. Vocal Range: B2-F#4. Black

SALARY

CORST $1270 weekly minimum (Tier X) - MSMT pays ﻿$1,500 weekly for Equity Members, favored ﻿nations for salaries

CONTRACT

Independent Theatre Contract

$440/week + Pension & Health - Negotiations pending.


SEEKING

Equity actors for roles in ROMEO AND JULIET (see breakdown).

About the production: Set in 1968, at the height of the Vietnam War and nationwide civil unrest, this reimagining of Romeo and Juliet places the Capulets and Montagues on opposite sides of a fractured America. The Capulets are Hawks—aligned with authority, tradition, and the war machine—while the Montagues are Doves, rooted in protest culture, resistance, and the push for social change. Against a backdrop of demonstrations, generational rupture, and escalating violence, Romeo and Juliet’s love becomes an act of defiance—exposing the human cost of ideological extremism and asking whether empathy can survive when a nation is at war with itself.

New Canon Theatre Co. welcomes submissions from actors of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Character descriptions serve as guides for this production concept. We encourage all artists to submit for roles that interest them.


PREPARATION

Please prepare two contrasting classical monologues (one in verse). Your slate and monologue should not exceed 3 minutes total.

BREAKDOWN

WEST SIDE STORY
